comment: Boy am I lucky I went into this class with a knowledge of C++ or I would have had a very hard time. Deciphering what this professor wants is harder than the assignments themselves, and good luck getting an email for clarification. The final questions require the book, so be prepared to have it before you open the midterm (ie out of town like me).
The class was online. He is a hard and difficult grader. He wants the answer exactly how he prefers. Garrett goes strictly off the book. Gives poor feedback on how to correct your mistakes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: If you already know C++ it is a frustrating easy A, always late, only talks about the content 10m each class. Nice guy, bad teacher. your time is better spent on google at home than it is sitting in class. doesn't allow you to go ahead and apply new things. barely speaks English and often will answer a question similar but unrelated to what you ask
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Barely has command of the English language. You usually end learning everything you need to know in the last 10 minutes of class. He usually shows up late, then teaches late. This is an easy A if you already know SQL and C#.

Absurdly bad teacher. Belittles students when they get things wrong on assignments. Not only did he comment on things that I got wrong, but he also commented on anything I got right with "Surprisingly, you got this right"  Barely speaks English, you will do nothing but diagrams up to AT LEAST the midterm. DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND DO NOT TAKE HIM.

This guy is very nice and he tries really hard. But he does not know how to teach. Have several unnecessarily difficult assignments with vague goals and vague grading schemes. Not a firm grasp on the English language. Lacks firm control of the classroom. Lectures sounded like he was mumbling to himself.
Very unclear during class, no practice given prior to grades, no partial credit, even for diagrams. Only take a course with this professor if you're trying to fail and not trying to learn anything
